raw_data.title: Program Manager - Cyber
raw_data.description: Oversees all aspects of cybersecurity programs and initiatives, directing teams in the execution of enterprise-level or mission-critical projects. Leads and coordinates cybersecurity efforts across technical, operational, and compliance domains. Analyzes complex cyber risk, threat, and vulnerability management challenges, developing innovative strategies and solutions that address security controls, system hardening, risk mitigation, and compliance with federal standards (such as NIST, FISMA, FedRAMP, and Zero Trust principles). Provides expertise in cybersecurity systems analysis and develops both near-term and long-range strategies for secure application selection, secure systems development, continuous monitoring, incident response, and sustainment activities. Ensures proper alignment of technology, methodology, tools, and resources to meet mission and regulatory requirements while balancing cost, schedule, and performance.
raw_data.education_and_experience_substitution: Associates plus 2 years relevant experience or HS  plus  years relevant experience
raw_data.required_certifications_or_licenses: PMP and CISSP highly desired

labor_categories.years_experience: Associates plus 2 years relevant experience or HS  plus  years relevant experience

raw_data.title: Application Systems Analyst - Code Reviewer
raw_data.description: Serves as a niche Cybersecurity resource on testing teams. Analyses data and systems architecture, creates designs, and implements information systems solutions. Looks for code vulnerabilities like buffer overflows, backdoors, or malicious code.  Intimately familiar with the OWASP Top 10 evaluation process.  Provides SME-level support for proposed fix actions and mitigation strategies. Assists project team in meeting program objectives timely and effectively. Assumes responsibility for process documentation and technical soundness
raw_data.education_and_experience_substitution: Associates plus 2 years relevant experience or HS  plus  years relevant experience
raw_data.required_certifications_or_licenses: One or more of the following certifications CISSP, GWAPT, OSCE, OSCP or GSSP-JAVA.

labor_categories.years_experience: Associates plus 2 years relevant experience or HS  plus  years relevant experience

raw_data.title: Red Team Operator III
raw_data.description: Provides SME-level support using and implementing Tools, Tactics, and Procedures (TTPs) consistent with cyber adversaries.  The operator uses tools such as Kali Linux, Metasploit, and other exploitation frameworks to gain and maintain access of a target environment. The lead operator reviews testing results and completes a formal report and out-briefing for target leadership, including potential mitigation strategies.

raw_data.title: Security Control Assessor (SCA) Test Engineer III
raw_data.description: Provides SME-level support performing manual testing, vulnerability scans, and penetration testing.  Performs analysis, web assessment software, vulnerability scanning, and penetration testing, and develop/deploy custom scripts, while applying knowledge of client/servers, web hosting, web content servers, policy servers, directory servers, firewalls, WAN, MAN, Local Area Network (LAN), switches, and routers; Windows, Linux, Unix, and Mac OS X administration; VMware, Xen, Hyper V and other virtualization platforms. Employs test plans and procedures tailored to the security controls of the system under test.

raw_data.title: Incident Response Analyst III
raw_data.description: Provides SME-level support implementing and operating tools that support network and host level forensics.  Reviews network flow data, host system and application logs, etc. to determine and reconstruct the compromise and subsequent events.  The SME reviews the data and provides a formal report to the cybersecurity leadership and system stakeholders for awareness and on-going response efforts.

raw_data.title: Program Manager - Technology
raw_data.description: Oversees all phases of IT professional services projects, directing technical teams in database planning and design, systems analysis, and enterprise integration efforts. Provides expertise in secure systems architecture, programming, conversion, and implementation support to ensure seamless deployment of technology solutions. Leads the development and execution of network services strategies, data/records management, and comprehensive testing activities to validate system performance and compliance. Analyzes complex technology challenges and develops innovative approaches leveraging industry best practices, federal standards, and emerging tools. Responsible for aligning technical methodology, tools, and resources with mission and business requirements, while balancing cost, schedule, and performance. Ensures long- and short-term planning for system development, operations, and sustainment in support of organizational and mission objectives.
raw_data.education_and_experience_substitution: Associates plus 2 years relevant experience or HS  plus  years relevant experience
raw_data.required_certifications_or_licenses: PMP and CISSP highly desired

raw_data.title: Zero Trust ISSO
raw_data.description: Provide support for developing the required security documentation for the development or update of Security Authorization Packages supporting the Authorization to Operate (ATO) decisions in an IT Environment. Perform Zero Trust support based on the NIST SP 800-207 and OMB 22-09 to NIST SP 800-53 and Risk Management Framework. Responsible for the cybersecurity of a program, organization, system, or enclave. Ensures that the security and privacy posture is maintained for an organizational system and works in close collaboration with the system owner. Serves as a principal advisor on all matters, technical and otherwise, involving the security and privacy controls for the system and has the knowledge and expertise to manage the security and privacy aspects of an organizational system.
raw_data.education_and_experience_substitution: 4 Years of experience for a Bachelors degree
raw_data.required_certifications_or_licenses: One or more of the following certifications is required: CISSP, CISM or CISA

labor_categories.years_experience: 4 Years of experience for a Bachelors degree

raw_data.title: Policy ISSO
raw_data.description: Develops and maintains cybersecurity and privacy plans, strategy, and policy to support and align with organizational cybersecurity and privacy initiatives and regulatory compliance. Reviews existing and proposed policies with stakeholders. Interprets and applies applicable laws, statutes, and regulatory documents and integrates into policy. Provides policy guidance to cyber management, staff, and users. Seeks consensus on proposed policy changes from stakeholders.

raw_data.required_certifications_or_licenses: One or more of the following certifications is required: CISSP, CISM, CASP, CAP, CEH, or CISA

raw_data.title: Project Manager - Cyber
raw_data.description: Oversees all aspects of designated cybersecurity projects, directing teams responsible for enterprise or mission-critical initiatives. Leads efforts on entire projects or significant segments of large and complex cybersecurity programs. Analyzes advanced and multifaceted security challenges, developing innovative solutions that incorporate scheduling, technology, methodology, tools, solution components, and financial management. Provides cybersecurity systems analysis and develops both near- and long-term plans for secure application selection, budgeting, secure systems development, continuous monitoring, maintenance, and production support. Ensures alignment with federal cybersecurity standards and mission objectives while managing resources to meet cost, schedule, and performance requirements.

Provides systems engineering and analysis support while developing both near- and long-term plans for application selection, budgeting, system development, conversion, maintenance, testing, and production support. labor_categories.labor_category: Subject Matter Expert - Enterprise Vulnerabilty Scanning

raw_data.title: Subject Matter Expert - Enterprise Vulnerabilty Scanning
raw_data.description: Provides technical knowledge and analysis of highly specialized applications and operational environment. Conducts vulnerability scans using various industry tools and automated scanners on high-level functional systems analysis, design, integration, documentation and implementation advice on highly complex problems relating to cyber security that require an appropriate level of knowledge of the subject matter for effective implementation. Apply principles, methods and knowledge of cyber security to specific task order requirements, advanced principles and methods to difficult and/or narrowly defined technical problems in cyber security. Assist other senior consultants with analysis and evaluation and with the preparation of recommendations for system improvements, optimization, development, and/or maintenance efforts in related domains.
raw_data.education_and_experience_substitution: Associates plus 2 years relevant experience or HS  plus  years relevant experience
raw_data.required_certifications_or_licenses: One or more of the following certifications CISSP, GWAPT, CEH, GCIH, or OSCP.

labor_categories.years_experience: Associates plus 2 years relevant experience or HS  plus  years relevant experience

labor_categories.labor_category: Subject Matter Expert - Web Application Penetration Testing

raw_data.title: Subject Matter Expert - Web Application Penetration Testing
raw_data.description: Provides technical knowledge and analysis of highly specialized applications and operational environment. Conducts web penetration testing to determine if the systems are susceptible to hacking by outside users. Conducts high-level functional systems analysis, design, integration, documentation and implementation advice on highly complex problems relating to cyber security that require an appropriate level of knowledge of the subject matter for effective implementation. Apply principles, methods and knowledge of cyber security to specific task order requirements, advanced principles and methods to difficult and/or narrowly defined technical problems in cyber security. Assist other senior consultants with analysis and evaluation and with the preparation of recommendations for system improvements, optimization, development, and/or maintenance efforts in related domains.  Intimate knowledge of common web application vulnerabilities as outlined in OWASP Top 10.
raw_data.education_and_experience_substitution: Associates plus 2 years relevant experience or HS  plus  years relevant experience
raw_data.required_certifications_or_licenses: One or more of the following certifications CISSP, GWAPT, CEH, or OSCP.

raw_data.description: Supports testing, test plan development, project management, contract administration, audit and other assessment functions throughout the engagement.
